page.title: 08HOUSING
page.content: Some of the{farm cottages}(cottar houses) and crofts have fallen into decay, but several have been bought and attractively renovated by people who work outside the area. There is one site of four{council-owned houses, built 30 years ago, and recently doubled-glazed, with new kitchens installed to bring them up to present day standards. All the houses are stone built with slate roofs, but few are of recent construction because of the{Disrict Council's policy}of not allowing sporadic housebuilding in rural areas unless specifically required for agricultural workers.This controversial policy has just been revoked.Although within commuting distance of Aberdeen there is no vacant housing available.
